dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey, B, have you seen the, like, viral badger footage from Kazakhstan popping up everywhere?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey, B, have you seen the, like, viral badger footage from Kazakhstan popping up everywhere?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Badgers from the Almaty State Nature Reserve have caught the attention of social media users.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, I think I did! Is that the one with the two badgers really going at it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, I think I did! Is that the one with the two badgers really going at it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It shows a real fight between two badgers, along with scenes from their everyday lives.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly! It's from the Almaty State Nature Reserve, uh, caught by a camera trap. So cool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly! It's from the Almaty State Nature Reserve, uh, caught by a camera trap. So cool.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Badgers from the Almaty State Nature Reserve have caught the attention of social media users. The footage was captured by a camera trap set up in a protected area.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, a camera trap! That's amazing. What kind of badgers are they, do we know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, a camera trap! That's amazing. What kind of badgers are they, do we know?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, these are European badgers, *Meles meles*. Super secretive animals, apparently, only really active at dawn, evening, and night.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, these are European badgers, Meles meles. Super secretive animals, apparently, only really active at dawn, evening, and night.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The European badger (Meles meles) inhabits the Almaty State Nature Reserve. It is especially active at dawn, in the evening, and at night, though it generally leads a secretive lifestyle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. Like, you don't just stumble upon them. So, what else did the camera traps show, besides the brawl?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. Like, you don't just stumble upon them. So, what else did the camera traps show, besides the brawl?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, just their everyday lives, you know? And, um, surprisingly, they're not picky eaters. Rodents, birds, eggs, snakes, insects...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, just their everyday lives, you know? And, um, surprisingly, they're not picky eaters. Rodents, birds, eggs, snakes, insects...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It isn™t picky about food: its diet includes small rodents, birds and their eggs, snakes, lizards, insects, and plant matter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Snakes? No way! I thought they were more, like, grubs and stuff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Snakes? No way! I thought they were more, like, grubs and stuff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely grubs too, but yeah, pretty much anything. They even, uh, sometimes come close to ranger posts looking for food.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely grubs too, but yeah, pretty much anything. They even, uh, sometimes come close to ranger posts looking for food.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In search of food, it may come close to forest ranger posts, the reserve staff noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh, interesting. And when do they, like, wake up from their hibernation?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh, interesting. And when do they, like, wake up from their hibernation?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Usually late February or early March. And then mating season kicks off, uh, March to June. Litters are usually one to five cubs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Usually late February or early March. And then mating season kicks off, uh, March to June. Litters are usually one to five cubs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Badgers usually wake from hibernation in late February or early March. Mating season runs from March to June, and litters typically consist of 1 to 5 cubs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Aww, little cubs! But I guess they've got predators out there too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Aww, little cubs! But I guess they've got predators out there too, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. Snow leopard, lynx, wolves, and even foxes are, um, on their tails.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. Snow leopard, lynx, wolves, and even foxes are, um, on their tails.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The animal™s main natural predators include the snow leopard, lynx, wolf, and fox.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, how are they getting all this, like, amazing info? Is it all from the camera traps?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, how are they getting all this, like, amazing info? Is it all from the camera traps?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, pretty much! In 2024 alone, badgers were recorded, like, 93 times by those cameras. It's incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, pretty much! In twenty twenty four alone, badgers were recorded, like, ninety three times by those cameras. It's incredible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2024, during scientific research on wildlife in the reserve, badgers were recorded 93 times by camera traps.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That is incredible. Reminds me of those rare imperial eagles they caught on camera in another reserve, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is incredible. Reminds me of those rare imperial eagles they caught on camera in another reserve, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, rare imperial eagles were captured on camera in the Ertis Ormany reserve in the Pavlodar region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally! The Ertis Ormany ones. It just shows how vital these, um, camera traps are for understanding wildlife.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally! The Ertis Ormany ones. It just shows how vital these, um, camera traps are for understanding wildlife.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Previously, rare imperial eagles were captured on camera in the Ertis Ormany reserve in the Pavlodar region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So much to learn from these secretive, uh, little guys.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So much to learn from these secretive, uh, little guys.
